prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: A new lawyer at the agency. She's been arrested as the suspect in the case.
Character 1
Name: Apollo Justice
Description: Currently working on his own. He says he wants to bring his friend's killer to justice, but I wonder if that's all.
Character 2
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: My daughter, who also happens to be an aspiring magician. I adopted her eight years ago.
Character 3
Name: Clay Terran
Description: The victim in this case. He was a HAT-2 crew member and a close friend of Apollo's.
Character 4
Name: Juniper Woods
Description: Athena's childhood friend. I defended her when she was on trial for the courtroom bombing incident.
Character 5
Name: Solomon Starbuck
Description: The defendant in this case.[1] He was a HAT-2 crew member and a mentor to the victim.
Character 6
Name: Simon Blackquill
Description: Convicted of the murder at the Space Center seven years ago. He's chasing a phantom he saw back then.
Character 7
Name: Bobby Fulbright
Description: The detective assigned to this case. He led the evacuation effort at the Space Center after the bombing incident.
Character 8
Name: Candice Arme
Description: A detective who specialized in bomb cases. Was on detail at the Space Center. One of the first to find the body.
Character 9
Name: Yuri Cosmos
Description: The director of the Space Center and one of the first people to discover the body. He seems exceedingly full of himself.
Character 10
Name: Ponco
Description: A guide robot at the Space Center. She can provide information on the Center and show people around.
Character 11
Name: Aura Blackquill
Description: A researcher who's developing robots at the Space Center. She is Prosecutor Blackquill's older sister.
Character 12
Name: Clonco
Description: One of the robots developed by Aura, who refers to him as "Hunk of Junk".
Character 13
Name: Metis Cykes
Description: Athena's mother and victim of the murder seven years ago. She was a talented psychologist like her daughter.
Character 14
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: A spirit medium in training. Her psychic powers are beyond question.
Character 15
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: The chief prosecutor. He's an old friend and a former prosecutor against whom I fought many courtroom battles.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. Proof of my profession.
Evidence 1
Name: Space Center Diagram
Description: A cross-section view of the main building of the Space Center and Launch Pad 1.
Evidence 2
Name: Utility Knife
Description: It has the victim's blood on it. From a set of utility tools used by Space Center techs. The murder weapon in this case. Athena also used one of these to stab the phantom's hand during the incident seven years ago.
Evidence 3
Name: Space Center Pamphlet
Description: It includes a diagram of the boarding lounge and a cross-section view of the Space Center. (3 pages.)
Evidence 4
Name: "Hope" Capsule
Description: Found in the victim's possession. It recently returned from a seven-year mission and contains asteroid samples. It was at the crime scene seven years ago. It was launched into space and only returned to Earth a few days ago.
Evidence 5
Name: HAT-1 Exhibit
Description: A newspaper clipping, a photo of the people involved with the launch, and a jacket one of them wore. A newspaper clipping, a photo of the people involved with the launch, and the jacket worn by Dr. Cykes.
Evidence 6
Name: Katana
Description: The weapon used in the murder seven years ago. It belonged to the victim. The victim's blood was found only on the blade.
Evidence 7
Name: Seven-Year-Old Video
Description: Video showing the corridor to the crime scene. Blackquill was the only one to pass through at the time of the crime.
Evidence 8
Name: Photo of the Crime
Description: Taken inadvertently. It became conclusive evidence at Simon Blackquill's trial seven years ago. The photo shows Blackquill taking the robot apart. There's a bloodstain at the end of the robot's arm.
Evidence 9
Name: Seven-Year-Old Photos
Description: Two photos of the body and crime scene. They were taken by the first person to discover the body. [caption] The victim is lying on the operating table. On the other side of the room is a workbench. The victim's clothes are drenched in blood.
Evidence 10
Name: Metis's Autopsy Report
Description: The cause of death was a stab wound to the chest. The weapon pierced the heart and so death was instantaneous.
Evidence 11
Name: Robots with a Heart
Description: It explains the recognition and communication features of the Ponco series of Robots.
Evidence 12
Name: Moon Rock Earring
Description: An earring that Dr. Cykes gave to Athena. The stone was cut from a real moon rock that was being used for research.
Evidence 13
Name: Phantom's Psych Profile
Description: The subject's emotions rarely fluctuate and he doesn't experience feelings like normal people do.
Evidence 14
Name: Terran's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death: Stabbing. The victim was discovered in the third-floor boarding lounge in the main building.
Evidence 15
Name: Security Camera Video
Description: Video showing the defendant and victim's escape from the corridor. The video ends immediately after this scene.
Evidence 16
Name: Launch Pad 1 Door Lock
Description: Starbuck's prints were found on this door lock. Also see photo taken after the incident. (2 pages.) The biometric door lock. Print authentication isn't required from the launch pad side. (2 pages.)
Evidence 17
Name: Aura's Statement
Description: The perp held a lighter with an Earth emblem on it in their left hand, and a knife in their right.
Evidence 18
Name: Lighter
Description: Evidence found by Detective Fulbright. It has Athena's prints on it in the victim's blood. A lighter that can transform into a handgun. It has Clay Terran's fingerprints and blood on it.
Evidence 19
Name: Emergency Ladder
Description: It was lowered to the ground from the window of the fourth-floor robotics lab. It was used to evacuate Space Center personnel.
Evidence 20
Name: Phony Phanty Bomb
Description: It was found in Boarding Lounge 1 and detonated in Courtroom No. 4. Fragments are being analyzed. (2 pages.)

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I felt fear when I thought about the moon rock because it reminded me of the phantom.
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 1
Testimony: Yes, I'm very afraid of him because he took my family hostage.
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 2
Testimony: What reason would the phantom have to be afraid of the moon rock?! None at all!
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 3
Testimony: So the very fact that I'm afraid of the moon rock means I'm not him!
Person: Fulbright
Testimony 4
Testimony: In fact, I'm on the side of... JUSTICE!
Person: Fulbright

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Okay, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other. So, the user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies. My job is to find a pair where the evidence directly contradicts a testimony.

First, I'll look through the testimonies. The testimonies given are all from Fulbright. Let me check them one by one. 

Testimony 0: Fulbright says he felt fear when thinking about the moon rock because it reminded him of the phantom. Testimony 1: He's afraid because the phantom took his family hostage. Testimony 2: He argues that the phantom has no reason to fear the moon rock. Testimony 3: Therefore, since he's afraid of the moon rock, he's not the phantom. Testimony 4: Claims he's on the side of justice.

Now, looking at the evidences. Evidence 13 is the Phantom's Psych Profile, which says the phantom's emotions rarely fluctuate and he doesn't feel like normal people. So, if the phantom can't feel fear normally, then Fulbright's fear of the moon rock (Testimony 3) would suggest he's not the phantom. But wait, there's Evidence 18: the Lighter with Athena's prints and victim's blood. But maybe that's not directly related. 

Wait, Evidence 13 is about the Phantom's psychological profile. If the Phantom doesn't experience normal emotions like fear, then Fulbright's claim in Testimony 3 that his fear of the moon rock proves he's not the phantom would make sense. But if there's evidence that contradicts this reasoning. Alternatively, maybe Evidence 18's lighter has Fulbright's prints? Wait, no, Evidence 18 says the lighter has Athena's prints and the victim's blood. So that's not directly related to Fulbright's testimony. 

Wait, let me check again. Testimony 3 is Fulbright saying that because he's afraid of the moon rock, he can't be the phantom. But the Phantom's Psych Profile (Evidence 13) states that the phantom doesn't experience normal emotions. So if Fulbright is the phantom, he shouldn't feel fear. However, he claims he does feel fear (Testimony 0 and 3), which would mean he's not the phantom. But if there's evidence that shows he is the phantom despite this, that would contradict. Wait, but maybe there's another angle. 

Alternatively, let's look at Evidence 17: Aura's Statement. She says the perp held a lighter with an Earth emblem in left hand and a knife in right. Evidence 18 is a lighter that can transform into a handgun, with Athena's prints. But Fulbright's testimony 3 is about his fear. Hmm, maybe that's not directly conflicting. 

Wait, Testimony 2: Fulbright says the phantom has no reason to fear the moon rock. Testimony 3: Therefore, his fear of the moon rock means he's not the phantom. But if the Phantom's Psych Profile (Evidence 13) says he can't feel fear normally, then Fulbright's fear would indeed indicate he's not the phantom. But maybe there's another evidence that shows Fulbright is the phantom, making his testimony a lie. However, looking at the evidences, Evidence 18 has Athena's prints, not Fulbright's. 

Wait, Evidence 18 says the lighter has Athena's prints. But Fulbright is the one testifying. So perhaps the contradiction is elsewhere. Let me check the other evidences. 

Evidence 2: Utility Knife. Athena used one to stab the phantom's hand seven years ago. The murder weapon here. But how does that relate to Fulbright's testimony?

Wait, the key contradiction here might be that Fulbright claims he's not the phantom because he feels fear (Testimony 3), but the Phantom's Psych Profile (Evidence 13) states that the phantom doesn't experience normal emotions. Therefore, if Fulbright is actually the phantom, his claim of fear would be impossible. So Evidence 13 contradicts Testimony 3. That's the pair. Because if the phantom can't feel fear, then Fulbright's assertion that his fear proves he's not the phantom is valid only if the profile is accurate. But if Fulbright is lying about his fear, then the contradiction arises. Wait, but how do we know he's lying? Wait, maybe there's another evidence. Let me check Evidence 13 again. The Phantom's Psych Profile: subject's emotions rarely fluctuate and doesn't experience feelings like normal people. So the phantom can't feel fear normally. If Fulbright is the phantom, then his fear (Testimony 0 and 3) is impossible. Therefore, the existence of Evidence 13 (Phantom's Psych Profile) contradicts Fulbright's Testimony 3, which relies on him feeling fear to prove he's not the phantom. But if the Phantom can't feel fear, then Testimony 3 is trying to use that fear as evidence he's not the phantom. However, if Fulbright is the phantom, he wouldn't feel fear, but he's claiming he does. Therefore, the contradiction would be between Evidence 13 and Testimony 3. Because if the Phantom can't feel fear, then Fulbright's fear is a valid reason he's not the Phantom, but if there's evidence that Fulbright is the Phantom despite his claim, then that would be a contradiction. Alternatively, maybe the fact that Fulbright is the phantom and yet claims fear contradicts the Psych Profile. So the pair would be Evidence 13 (Phantom's Psych Profile) and Testimony 3 (Fulbright's claim that his fear proves he's not the phantom). But since the Phantom can't feel fear, if Fulbright is the Phantom, then his testimony is a lie. Therefore, the evidence (Phantom's profile) contradicts his testimony (claiming fear). So the answer should be {"evidence": 13, "testimony": 3}. But let me double-check. Yes, that makes sense. The Psych Profile says the Phantom doesn't experience normal emotions, so if Fulbright is the Phantom, he shouldn't feel fear. Therefore, his claim that he's afraid (Testimony 3) is contradicted by Evidence 13.

{"evidence": 13, "testimony": 3}
